title: Mailer missing template in Rails 5 api_only
body:
I am currently trying to set up a mailer on my Rails 5 api_only server. I get the following error:

```
(Missing template user_mailer/welcome_email with "mailer". Searched in:
  * "user_mailer"
):
```

The mailer looks as follows:

```
class UserMailer < ApplicationMailer
  default from: 'xx@xxx.com'

  def welcome_email(user)
    @user = user
    @url  = 'http://0.0.0.0:3000/login'
    mail(to: 'xxx@xxxxx.com', subject: 'Welcome to the site')
  end
end
```
There are indeed views located at `views/user_mailer/welcome_email.html.erb` and `views/user_mailer/welcome_email.text.erb`.

The mailer is temporarily being called in the controller's show method:

```
def show
   UserMailer.welcome_email(@user).deliver_now
   render json: @user
end
```

I have tried setting `config.api_only = false` and I've also stopped Spring several times. I am using Rails 5.0.0.beta1.

title: Remove unused require
body:
`require 'active_support/core_ext/benchmark'` was added by 4ecdf24.
But currently unused anymore.

title: rails5 authenticity_token and csrf-tokens don't match
body:
This will cause problems for automation tools like mechanize. Reproduction instructions: view source on any page that uses `form_for`. Any edit page generated by scaffolding will do. What you will see will be something like: ``` Demo

Editing Company

Show | Back ``` The important lines are: ``` ``` and ``` ``` Note that the values don't match. They do with Rails 4.x releases.

title: Avoid a string value truncation in uniqueness validation
body:
In MySQL and PostgreSQL, a value over the limit cannot be inserted
or updated (See #23522).

In SQLite3, a value is inserted or updated regardless of the limit.

We should avoid a string value truncation in uniqueness validation.

title: Add `ActiveRecord::ValueTooLong` exception class
Fix `assert_in_delta` test failure
body:
`assert_in_delta` in `timestamp_test.rb` causes an intermittent test
failure. It looks like that caused by subseconds truncation in MySQL 5.5.

Example:

```
  1) Failure:
  TimestampTest#test_touching_many_attributes_updates_them [/home/travis/build/rails/rails/activerecord/test/cases/timestamp_test.rb:125]:
  Expected |2016-02-06 09:22:10 +0000 - 2016-02-06 09:22:09 UTC| (1.000837185) to be <= 1.
```

https://travis-ci.org/rails/rails/jobs/107415700#L447-L449

title: Remove duplicated `require 'arel'`
body:
It appears first in `lib/active_record.rb`.

https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v5.0.0.beta2/activerecord/lib/active_record.rb#L27

title: MariaDB does not support JSON type
body: Fixes #22980.

title: Speed up ActionDispatch::Reloader for static assets. Fix #23510
body: Bypass ActionDispatch::Reloader middleware for non-Ruby code and serve assets in O(1) time regardless of application size (LOC and gems set), helpful mostly in development mode.

title: Replace old Rails greeting references
body:
A couple of the READMEs were still referring the old welcome page. This
is a small change that goes over them.

title: Add `Hash#force_compact`
Extract `arel_visitor` and move up to the abstract adapter
Revert "When generating a mailer, you must specify Mailer in the class name in"
body:
This reverts commit 8417d967e016f0219cc4ec30bf0d3908ce6cd29b.

In 5697bdb and af3eb59, add mailer suffix to generated files and classes.
Therefore, no longer need to specify `Mailer` to class name. [ci skip]

title: Revert "No need to specify Ruby patch version on Travis CI"
body:
Reverts rails/rails#23502

Looks like test failures have been caused by this.

title: set association name to generated fixtures if attribute is reference
body:
It has been changed to require `belongs_to` by default in Rails 5.
Therefore in order to pass the controller test, have association of set to fixtures.

Fixes #23384

title: Time.now.today? #=> false (8:15PM, EST, February 5, 2016)
body:
So if you run this command:

    Time.now.today?

It will return false on 8:15PM in the EST.

I'm on a Mac El Capitan, ruby 2.2.1p85, rails 4.0.0. (Don't want to upgrade rails because it breaks `ActiveRecord::Base.silence {}`)

I assume this is because the #today? method is using UTC or GMT as the assumed time zone in this case rather than EST?

I'll leave this to the experts. Good day, gentlemen.

title: Speed up ActionDispatch::Reloader for static assets 10x
body:
Given a dummy Rails app with large number of scaffold-generated objects (Code LOC: 18849) and hundred gems (sample taken from https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/master/Gemfile) tried to measure performance hit for static assets. Newelic in development mode helped to figure it out thoroughly.

The problem is a middleware responsible for [Ruby classes reload](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/857263445035404786e1f9785b76f3f4ddb7ca12/railties/lib/rails/application/default_middleware_stack.rb#L63-L65) slows serving static assets down. Profiling with Newrelic shows the following results (88% spent on Reloader middleware):

![screen shot 2016-02-06 at 01 08 48](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14601/12863468/5ecfdcb4-cc6e-11e5-8c38-2afed69d1023.png)

siege benchmark results (siege -b http://localhost:3000/assets/application.js):
```
Transaction rate:	        2.60 trans/sec
Concurrency:		       11.87
```

I tried to skip this middleware for static assets based on condition expression (correct me if I'm wrong) *env['PATH_INFO'].include?(Rails.application.config.assets.prefix)* the results suprised me a bit:

![screen shot 2016-02-06 at 01 09 30](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14601/12863470/62b71612-cc6e-11e5-8ad1-bae964ad4e59.png)


siege benchmark results (siege -b http://localhost:3000/assets/application.js):
```
Transaction rate:	       16.13 trans/sec
Concurrency:		       11.82
```

Having some change in application.js doesn't require rails server to restart, changes reloaded on-fly as usual, the difference is no callbacks chain and no clears dependencies for static assets anymore.

This change makes a diffference in development mode when serve static assets without Nginx. Please let me know what you think, patch is available as gist for a moment: https://gist.github.com/mikhailov/7e6d925044327a87db4f

Increase LOC from 18K to 27K followed by slowness of response for non-patched middleware. It seems the complexity is O(n) compare to O(1) for code with the patch.

title: Rails 5 Beta2 link_to issue with post method
body: `resources :smiley_images do member do ... post :random_add_to_default end end` which produces this route: `random_add_to_default_smiley_image POST /smiley_images/:id/random_add_to_default(.:format)` `<%= link_to 'Random smiley collection', random_add_to_default_smiley_image_path(@sc.id), method: :post, class: 'link' %>` Generates: `Random smiley collection` Which produces: `ActionController::RoutingError (No route matches [GET] "/smiley_images/1/random_add_to_default")` I have `<%= javascript_include_tag 'application' %>` no turbolinks since it blows up on multiple layouts and themes, at least it did in Rails 4.

title: Added numeric helper into `SchemaStatements` for MySQL and PostgreSQL
body:
With this addition, you can add a column into the table like:

```
  create_table(:numeric_types) do |t|
    t.numeric :foo, precision: 10, scale: 2, default: 2.0
  end
```

This migration creates a `numeric` column for PostgreSQL and `decimal` column for MySQL. The result of the migration above is same with:

```
  create_table(:numeric_types) do |t|
    t.decimal :foo, precision: 10, scale: 2, default: 2.0
  end
```

In PostgreSQL decimal and numeric types are same. Decimal is alias for numeric. For more information about numeric types in PostgreSQL see http://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/interactive/datatype-numeric.html
In MySQL decimal and numeric types are same. Numeric is alias for decimal. For more information about fixed point types in MySQL see http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/fixed-point-types.html

title: Performance regression caused by cbcdecd
body:
http://rubybench.org/rails/rails/commits?result_type=activerecord/postgres_finders_find_by_attributes&display_count=1000

It's a strange dip which I wouldn't have expected to see. I'll take a look at this on Monday.

title: action_cable.url have no impact on action_cable_meta_tag
body:
I set `config.action_cable.url = 'ws://localhost:3000/cable'` on my `development.rb` to use ActionCable while using BrowserSync. But `action_cable_meta_tag` returns `<meta name="action-cable-url" content="ws://localhost:4000/cable">`

I have BrowserSync on 4000 port. I've used before rails 5.0.0.beta1 so i had to change some configs for ActionCable to work. Am i doing something wrong?

title: Inject Rails related configuration through Railtie
body:
Instead of direct coupling we can inject configuration. This also spares us some setup in tests.

Work in progress. Need to consider better error messages, better docs, tests.

Would also like to tackle the `inner_logger` + `TaggedLoggerProxy.new` test setup, but unsure what to do there at the moment. Maybe we can move `new_tagged_logger` to the server?

cc @rafaelfranca @matthewd

title: ActiveRecord marks 'serialize' columns dirty on initialization in Rails 4.1
body:
While upgrading an app from Rails 3.2 to Rails 4.0 we discovered a change in the behaviour of serialize columns on initialization. The issue still exists in Rails 4.1 and is caused by a bug in the ActiveRecord initialization logic.

The problem is that serialize columns are marked as change on initialization. The failing check is at https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/4-1-stable/activerecord/lib/active_record/attribute_methods/dirty.rb#L58

The check fails because it attempts to compare a literal value to a member in @attributes which in the case of serialized columns is a ActiveRecord::AttributeMethods::Serialization::Attribute instead of a literal value.

The failing example in Rails 4.1:
```ruby
begin
  require 'bundler/inline'
rescue LoadError => e
  $stderr.puts 'Bundler version 1.10 or later is required. Please update your Bundler'
  raise e
end

gemfile(true) do
  source 'https://rubygems.org'
  gem 'rails', github: 'rails/rails', branch: '4-1-stable'
  gem 'arel', github: 'rails/arel', branch: '5-0-stable'
  gem 'rack', github: 'rack/rack', branch: '1-5-stable'
  gem 'sprockets', github: 'rails/sprockets', branch: '2.x'
  gem 'sprockets-rails', github: 'rails/sprockets-rails', branch: '2.x'
  gem 'sass-rails', github: 'rails/sass-rails', branch: '4-0-stable'
  gem 'sqlite3'
end

require 'active_record'
require 'minitest/autorun'
require 'logger'

# This connection will do for database-independent bug reports.
ActiveRecord::Base.establish_connection(adapter: 'sqlite3', database: ':memory:')
ActiveRecord::Base.logger = Logger.new(STDOUT)

ActiveRecord::Schema.define do
  create_table :posts, force: true  do |t|
    t.string :data
  end
end

class Post < ActiveRecord::Base
  serialize :data
end

class BugTest < Minitest::Test
  def test_association_stuff
    post = Post.new

    assert_equal [], post.changes.keys
  end
end
```

The output:
```
Fetching git://github.com/rails/rails.git
Fetching git://github.com/rails/arel.git
Fetching git://github.com/rack/rack.git
Fetching git://github.com/rails/sprockets.git
Fetching git://github.com/rails/sprockets-rails.git
Fetching git://github.com/rails/sass-rails.git
Fetching gem metadata from https://rubygems.org/...........
Fetching version metadata from https://rubygems.org/...
Fetching dependency metadata from https://rubygems.org/..
Resolving dependencies...
Using rake 10.5.0
Using i18n 0.7.0
Using json 1.8.3
Using minitest 5.8.4
Using thread_safe 0.3.5
Using builder 3.2.2
Using erubis 2.7.0
Using rack 1.5.5 from git://github.com/rack/rack.git (at 1-5-stable@e7e0646)
Using mime-types 2.99
Using arel 5.0.1.20140414130214 from git://github.com/rails/arel.git (at 5-0-stable@291682d)
Using bundler 1.11.2
Using hike 1.2.3
Using multi_json 1.11.2
Using thor 0.19.1

Using sqlite3 1.3.11
Using tzinfo 1.2.2
Using rack-test 0.6.3
Using mail 2.6.3
Using sprockets 2.12.4 from git://github.com/rails/sprockets.git (at 2.x@2199a60)
Using activesupport 4.1.14.1 from git://github.com/rails/rails.git (at 4-1-stable@331210d)
Using actionview 4.1.14.1 from git://github.com/rails/rails.git (at 4-1-stable@331210d)
Using activemodel 4.1.14.1 from git://github.com/rails/rails.git (at 4-1-stable@331210d)
Using actionpack 4.1.14.1 from git://github.com/rails/rails.git (at 4-1-stable@331210d)
Using activerecord 4.1.14.1 from git://github.com/rails/rails.git (at 4-1-stable@331210d)
Using actionmailer 4.1.14.1 from git://github.com/rails/rails.git (at 4-1-stable@331210d)
Using railties 4.1.14.1 from git://github.com/rails/rails.git (at 4-1-stable@331210d)
Using sprockets-rails 2.3.3 from git://github.com/rails/sprockets-rails.git (at 2.x@74fba9f)

Using sass-rails 4.0.5 from git://github.com/rails/sass-rails.git (at 4-0-stable@8588b7b)
-- create_table(:posts, {:force=>true})
D, [2016-02-05T16:00:13.175667 #76395] DEBUG -- :    (0.7ms)  CREATE TABLE "posts" ("id" INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT NOT NULL, "data" varchar(255))
   -> 0.0063s
Run options: --seed 11106

# Running:

F

Finished in 0.003666s, 272.7644 runs/s, 272.7644 assertions/s.

  1) Failure:
BugTest#test_association_stuff [active_record_master-4.1.rb:41]:
Expected: []
  Actual: ["data"]

1 runs, 1 assertions, 1 failures, 0 errors, 0 skips
```

Passing example on 4.2:
```ruby
begin
  require 'bundler/inline'
rescue LoadError => e
  $stderr.puts 'Bundler version 1.10 or later is required. Please update your Bundler'
  raise e
end

gemfile(true) do
  source 'https://rubygems.org'
  gem 'rails', github: 'rails/rails', branch: '4-2-stable'
  gem 'arel', github: 'rails/arel', branch: '6-0-stable'
  gem 'rack', github: 'rack/rack', branch: '1-6-stable'
  gem 'sprockets', github: 'rails/sprockets', branch: '2.x'
  gem 'sprockets-rails', github: 'rails/sprockets-rails', branch: '2.x'
  gem 'sass-rails', github: 'rails/sass-rails', branch: '4-0-stable'
  gem 'sqlite3'
end

require 'active_record'
require 'minitest/autorun'
require 'logger'

# This connection will do for database-independent bug reports.
ActiveRecord::Base.establish_connection(adapter: 'sqlite3', database: ':memory:')
ActiveRecord::Base.logger = Logger.new(STDOUT)

ActiveRecord::Schema.define do
  create_table :posts, force: true  do |t|
    t.string :data
  end
end

class Post < ActiveRecord::Base
  serialize :data
end

class BugTest < Minitest::Test
  def test_association_stuff
    post = Post.new

    assert_equal [], post.changes.keys
  end
end
```

title: rails5 ActionController::Live causes requests to hang
body:
Adding the following to any controller:

```ruby
include ActionController::Live
```

causes all requests to hang.

Full scenario: http://intertwingly.net/tmp/live_hang.html#create_company

title: No need to specify Ruby patch version on Travis CI
body: Travis CI now select the latest patch version of Ruby automatically when given MAJOR.MINOR version string.

title: No need to specify Ruby patch version on Travis CI
body:
Travis CI now select the latest patch version of Ruby automatically when given MAJOR.MINOR version string.

This is for `4-2-stable`.

title: When generating a mailer, you must specify Mailer in the class name
body:
The usage docs for generating a mailer are missing Mailer in the name of the mailer.  If you don't add Mailer to the name, your views and tests are generated incorrectly.

Based on the existing docs, if you do this:
`rails generate mailer School welcome`
The views will be put in app/views/school and the tests will refer to a School class.

You must run the generator like this:
`rails generate mailer SchoolMailer welcome`

These comment and usage changes reflect this requirement.

title: Run one JRuby worker on CI; allow to fail
body:
Ref:
- https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/0e8c04529159522aadbfe4fe71ea3d326df07d52
- https://github.com/rails/rails/issues/11700#issuecomment-21955029

title: Don't unnecessarily load a belongs_to when saving.
body:
Previously, if the the association was previously loaded and then
the foreign key changed by itself, a #save call would trigger a
load of the new associated record during autosave. This is unnecessary
and the autosave code (in that case) didn't use the loaded record
anyways.

title: Extract `extract_schema_qualified_name` method
